original: Bergquist, Harry JuHus Albin, lektor, Göteborg, f. 15/4/00 i Härad, Södermani. 1., av folksk :lär. o. musikdir. Janne B. o. Julia Peterson. G. 32 m. fil. mag. Ester Nordin. Barn: Birgit- ta f. 37, Ragnihild 42. ~ Stud:ex. 18, fil. kand. 22, fil. mag. 24, fil. lic. 32, fil. dr 33 samt provår 32-33, allt i Sthlm, stud. v. Kristinebergs zool. stat. somr. 19, 24 o. 25. Stud:res. t. TyskL, Schweiz, Frankr., Ital., Tyro-len, Norge, Finl., Danm. m. fl. Lär. f. H. K. H. Hertigen av Småland 24- 27, f. H. K. H. Hertigen av Dalarna 27-28, doc. i zoologi v. Sthlms högsk. 32-36, periodv. vik. adj. samt e. lär. v. olika lärov. i Sthlm 27-36, lektor i biol. m. hälsolära o. kemi v. Vänersborgs h. a. 1. 36-42, dito v. h. a. 1. i Majorna i Gbg sed. 42. Tjänstegrens-chef f. gasskyddet i Vänersborg 38-42, under samma tid bitr. länsstyr. m. ett filert. kurser i gas skyddstjänst i olika delar av länet. Ordf. i Sthlms kristl. situd:fören. 26-28, led. av styr. f. Sv:es kriistl. studentrörelse, stift. Studihemmet i Sthlm 27-36, ordf. i Sthlms högsk. zoologkl. 31-32, idépo-litiskt arb. i den nysv. rör., sekr. i v. krets, av Biologilär. fören. m. m. Skr.: Jämf.-anat. studie över hjärnkärnor-nas utveckl. i mellanhjärnan h. lägre ryggradsdjur (grad:avh.), skilda upps. i tidn. o. tidskr.
translated: Bergquist, Harry JuHus Albin, lecturer, Gothenburg, born April 15th, 1900 in Härad, Södermani. First-born child of elementary school teacher and music director Janne B. and Julia Peterson. Married in 1932 to Ester Nordin, who holds a degree in philology. They have two children: Birgit-ta (born in 1937) and Ragnihild (born in 1942). Harry passed his matriculation exam in 1918 and obtained his Bachelor of Arts degree in 1922, his Master of Arts degree in 1924, his Licentiate of Philosophy degree in 1932, and his Doctorate of Philosophy degree in 1933 - all in Stockholm. He studied at Kristinebergs Zoological Station during the summers of 1919, 1924, and 1925, and conducted study trips to Germany, Switzerland, France, Italy, Tyrol, Norway, Finland, Denmark, and other countries. He was a lecturer for the Duke of Smaland from 1924 to 1927 and for the Duke of Dalarna from 1927 to 1928. From 1932 to 1936, he was a docent in zoology at Stockholm University, and from 1927 to 1936, he served as a temporary adjunct and regular teacher at various high schools in Stockholm. From 1936 to 1942, he was a lecturer in biology, health science, and chemistry at the high school in Vänersborg, and then transferred to the same position at the high school in Majorna, Gothenburg, where he has been since 1942. From 1938 to 1942, he served as the head of the gas protection department in Vänersborg, while also assisting the county government with a series of courses on gas protection services held throughout the county. He was the chairman of the Stockholm Christian Situd Society from 1926 to 1928, a member of the board of the Swedish Christian Student Movement, and a founder of the student home in Stockholm from 1927 to 1936. He was also the chairman of the Zoological Club of Stockholm University from 1931 to 1932, and was involved in ideological work in the emerging Swedish movement, serving as the secretary in various circles of the Biology Teachers Association, among other things. Harry's academic work includes a comparative anatomical study of the development of brain nuclei in midbrain and lower vertebrates (degree thesis), as well as various publications in newspapers and journals.
